If you enter settings and then the touch menu, you can turn on 'enable new touch control schemes' and then you can change the 'interaction model' in the drop box below to touch, crosshair or classic.

If you feel the joystick is taking up too much of the screen you can change the settings/touch options to turn off 'move joystick visible' and 'move joystick visible when not moving'. This will hide the joystick.

If you do not like the joystick being fixed in the corner of the screen in the setting/touch options you can turn off 'static joystick'. This will then generate the joystick wherever you touch the screen :)

After trying this out I doubt I'll ever use this because the old ones are just better but I'll share my thoughts. Also, something seems to have been done to the way you turn the screen which makes it much harder to spin around. In all it seems to me like this control scheme was put together almost entirely with cross hair controls in mind (specifically because the buttons now take up most of the screen) which is silly because that is definetly the most inefficient way of controlling on a mobile device. Make an option to customize the entire button layout, such as position, size & opacity of each button/joystick. This is a must-have for many mobile games! I prefer to use 4 fingers (thumbs & index finger), and I'd like buttons on the upper corners.

Adding optional buttons to quick-switch items in the hotbar is also welcome, as right now it's extremely difficult in mobile. In PC, you can use the 1-9 buttons. Have an add-button option that allows me to quickly select my crossbow on slot 2, for example. (Please fix fireworks crossbow on Bedrock, it doesn't explode on impact!)

An optional "safe mode" toggle button which prevents the player from interacting is VERY welcome, especially on touch controls. I always hit villagers & place blocks accidentally.

For the old touch controls, I often find myself trying to move my character, but ended up stopping & looking around. It's bad touch controls; if you slide your finger too far away from the D-pad, you'll end up not moving. I hope this issue is fixed. Having to "target" an NPC to interact is also unintuitive, such as feeding cats/parrots (try it!). NPCs in front of the player should be easily interactable.

Add optional action buttons for touch controls as well. Having to hold-touch to shoot crossbows & catching fish in a bucket is very slow/wonky.

Add an auto-sprint option when not crouching. Players will almost-always sprint instead of walk, and having to use a sprint button (or pushing the joystick far away) can be annoying.

• These are a few things that i like about the ‚Äúcrosshair‚Äù control.  
  1. The new ‚Äúsprint on movement feature is so helpful, I love it. 
  2. The ability to turn on and off ‚Äútoggle crouch‚Äù is very nice. I can imagine playing with friends now and doing the friendship wiggle that wasn‚Äôt really possible before. 
  3. The ability to hold down the interact button and place blocks in a line is very helpful for building and bridging. 
  4. Also when hold a crossbow, it‚Äôs so much easier to use because you don‚Äôt have to awkwardly hold down on the screen. 

     A few things I don‚Äôt really like:

  1. The placement of all of the interact and attack buttons is not to my preference. I would love to be able to customize where on the screen to put those buttons and to rearrange them, but if not possible at least a little lower on the screen. (I am playing on an iPad Air)
  • What i like about the ‚Äútouch‚Äù setting:
  1. It doesn‚Äôt feel all that different from the classic, so it shouldn‚Äôt be that hard to adjust. 

     What i don‚Äôt like:

  1. i have always preferred playing with split controls on before so to me it feels a little clunky. 
  • Overall feelings about the crosshair and touch settings

Overall i like the change, it feels a lot more versatile (especially on crosshair). However, there are a few things that i would love give some feed back on. Firstly, the position of all the buttons on the right feels clunky to me. And secondly, when holding the up or down button when flying you can‚Äôt move your camera angle which us annoying.

After trying my shot with the new controls I have the following thoughts and comments and I hope they can be of use.

I will start by saying that as a player that has played for so long, I have become accustomed to having my sneak and jump swapped. Because of this the transition to the joystick with a completely separated jump button was a challenge but not impossible. I 100% prefer having my jump button on the left with the rest of my controls for easy movement because it only requires one of my fingers while in the new interface it requires both. For example, I love to be able to be crouching, moving, and even jumping up a block or multiple, all while having my bow loaded. I cannot do this with the joystick and I believe that is a huge problem with it.

What I do like about the crosshair is the two buttons for placing and breaking, I‚Äôm not sure why but it just feels nice and more pleasant to use.

As for the touch I once again do not like that I am unable to jump while having a loaded bow but other than that there is not much to say.

In both instances I detest the sprint button being way off to the side (I am aware that it can be automatic, and that is better but not perfect)

As for the joystick itself, i like the feel and movement of it although it is way too big on my phone‚Äôs screen and I am having to reach with my thumb to move.

As a final thought I would say that the current setup "classic" is definitely better and I would not want to use something lesser.

When thinking about how intuitive each control setup provides, I would say that they almost all have challenges.

While the touch and crosshair have individual buttons for each action, they are not that intuitive and it is difficult to differentiate between some buttons that need to be held, tapped, double tapped or other.

Meanwhile, classic only has sprint which is hard to find but that is discoverable with time as the player progresses in their world which I‚Äôd say is a good thing because it doesn‚Äôt confuse a new player with an extra button and it is not needed early hame but can be handy once discovered later by trial and error or accidentally in classic.

I have mixed feelings about the new controls but I think that providing the player with options is the best solution. Let the player customize their experience and please never take away the current classic controls because they are simply superior at the moment. Thanks : )

hi.
After much scrutiny, I have analysed a few critical improvement points for the joystick control scheme. 1. With the Classic controls, using swap jump and sneak, I could continuously and fluidly sprint jump by moving my thumb from the forward button down to the jump button directly below it, and back up in one motion and repeat. Since one hand should be used for movement and the other for attack (left to move, right to attack for righties), my proposal is for jump to activate when the joystick (your thumb) is quickly moved up and down in one motion outside the joystick circle, toggleable of course. 2. As for the current jump button, it should continuously jump when held down, similar to keyboard. 3. There is a bug involving static mode + move to sprint where it skips from slow walk to sprint. There is no normal walking speed phase. 4. A common suggestion by the other commenters, there should be custom placement and more customisability of the buttons as seen in other mobile games, like Soul Knight (not sponsored). 

Additionally, a few noteworthy bugs and features for mobile: 1. screen glitch on mobile (not tested if still present). 2. text copy and pasting and better text editing (useful for command blocks and book and quills). 3. adjustable hold delay before a projectile is thrown or an action activates because I find it too slow.

Otherwise, this was an amazing implementation of features I was looking for, such as better sprint mechanisms.

The new controls are looking really good so far, and I am happy that Mojang is listening to the community! The mobile controls have been in desperate need of a revamp, and I'm glad that they are finally getting some attention. Here are a few things that I would like to suggest:

  1. Make the control interface/layout fully customisable. This means being able to individually move around each of the buttons and the joystick/d-pad and change their individual size and opacity. This is very important as the mobile version of Minecraft is played on devices of varying shapes and sizes, and people have different preferences and hand sizes, so it is crucial that everyone can customise the button layout to suit what they find most comfortable and don't have to cramp up their hands into awkward positions.
  2. Include the option to add/remove extra buttons to the interface, such as a camera cycle button (to switch between 1st and 3rd person). Currently the only way to do this is to go into the settings, making it impossible to change your perspective while playing something like hunger games. A 'drop item' button (holding down on an item in your hotbar is very slow and feels clunky), a 'swap with offhand' button, a 'pick block' button (useful for building in creative mode), and buttons to go up/down the hotbar.

Also, make holding the jump button make you jump continuously.

Overall, I think that a well thought out revamp to the touch controls will help Minecraft P.E. live up to its true potential. :)

Attack/place (interact) buttons (and thier toggleable joysticks)on mobile equivalent to trigger and right joystick actions at the same time on PS4 and right and left click with mouse movement on PC( this is for server goers who play PvP and see just how much better PC players are against them because they can multitask (jump and adjust crosshair on them while attacking, all at the same time)
Second joystick (look around) equivalent to LEARN on p4 and mouse on PC
Jump(and it's joystick) equivalent to space bar and mouse action of jumping and looking around or determining in which direction players jump and joystick and X on ps4
Perspective (camera icon) on mobile is equivalent to f5 on PC and the top button on dpad on PS4
Drop item (double tap item in hotbar for.popup button) equivalent to Q on PC and down button on dpad on PS4
It goes on and this is how we can create some semblance of parity between the different devices and help us mobile players adjust to multtasking ability of players on other devices

Crosshair:

Like: Easier to shoot while using bows, crossbows and tridents, easier to fly with an elytra, easier to interact with mobs without accidentally punching them, and faster to break blocks and eat instead of having to hold.

Dislike: Fighting in PvE and PvP is even more clumsy than before, its extremely hard to aim rapidly while moving to hit, so you have to rely completely on your shield. It's almost impossible to land critical hits on a player or hostile mob since you have to use your index to jump and thumb to attack.

Building: while more precise, became slower, mainly when towering or bridging, since every time you have to slightly change the angle that you are aiming you have to not only completely stop placing blocks but you have to also put your finger away from the button.

Recommendations: Make it so that, if you have a block in your hand, you can hold the Interact button to keep placing it (like holding right-click in Java).

Allow for manual toggle of Jumping to avoid having to keep pressing it while sprint-jumping and towering.

Bugs: When trying to aim with one finger and press the attack or interaction button with another, your character suddenly starts looking down.

Also, sometimes the crouch gets pressed while drawing my finger over the screen and not wanting to press it.

Ive been using the new Touch Controls on my Iphone SE.  version 1.19.40.  I prefer the touch controls over the crosshair controls.  My only issue seems to be the interaction with mobs.  Specifically villagers.  I find it very difficult to have the "trade" button pop-up so I can open the Trade GUI along with any mob that I interact with such as horse or Lama.  I cannot find the specific position on the screen to center the mob to interact with it.  Also because the mob is constantly moving around it becomes extremely difficult.

Terraria could be a good source of inspiration, but the jumpbridging and pvp is amazing. The old wasd-like arrows are good because with joystick I sometimes have troubles with sprinting on 1 block wide bridge.

We should be able to move the buttons, change their size, opacity, and allow them to go off the screen. ( If you look at any mobile FPS games, nearly every one has these options ). The configuration you have them in now is just in general bad. They are uncomfortable to use and they are hard to press since we are basically forced to play claw ( using 3 or 4 fingers ) with them ( Most people who play claw make the buttons pretty big and opaque so they don't accidentally miss the button but still being able to see behind it. The button also tends to go off the screen since accidentally hitting the edge of the screen because you can't put the button there is infuriating.

I would also like to see an option to be able to change the sprint to hold instead of toggle and being able to change the joystick to move at max walking speed ( similar to how you can use wasd on pc to move 100% walking speed instantly ). 

Looking at these other suggestions, a shift click action to quickly craft the maximum you can or quickly move something into your inventory would be pretty cool. This could be just another button we can customize that would only appear in the crafting or inventory interfaces. Another one would be an F5 button to quickly change the perspective since that is a bit tedious on mobile.

In the end, the controls are a step in the right direction but there is a lot that can be improved.

Please improve the touch controls for Minecraft Bedrock Edition on mobile.

Currently:

Action buttons (attack, place, jump) can accidentally slide off the button, moving the camera.

Buttons cannot be freely placed anywhere on the screen.

Multi-finger (claw) gameplay is difficult because touches interfere with each other.

I suggest adding:

Button Lock ‚Äì when pressing attack/place/jump, the touch stays locked even if the finger moves slightly.
Custom Button Placement ‚Äì allow players to freely place buttons anywhere on the screen, including edges and corners.

Better Multi-Touch Support ‚Äì prevent the camera from moving during multi-finger actions.

Gesture Blocking ‚Äì disable Android swipe-up gestures while playing to avoid accidental swipes.

These improvements would make Minecraft BETA much easier and smoother to play for touchscreen and claw-style users. Thank you!
